text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Prime Minister Alfred Sant says Value Added Tax will be out by July. The government is considering a system to replace VAT by a system of customs and excise duties, but a final draft law has not been published yet.
- Industry minister says small enterprises will be given new incentives in bill due to be published next week.

- Air Malta to lose out from European Union deregulation of air services. The Maltese national airline is not expected to be granted privileges it could have been given had Malta maintained its application to join the European Union.
- Small fire on Croation tanker at Malta Drydocks. No one injured.
- Man recounts last hours of friend who died of drug overdose.
